rComments: I think Peter Beyer is probably one of the best professors I have had. His lectures are VERY interesting. His marking is very fair. There is a lot of reading, but it isn't too bad. I would recommend his class.

It was a tough class, not going to lie about that, but Beyer was great. He obviously REALLY knows his stuff. Requires a bit more focus than most people have at 8:30 in the morning, though. It's also a bit more theorist-heavy than most religion courses, so beware. Still, it's a good course with a good prof.

He's very versed in his subject, but I think this gives him a disadvantage in teaching it, or asking questions about it. His questions are more like mini essays where he navigates around a topic before getting to the point. This would be fine, however, his marking is a lot like this too. It's very hard to know what material you should include or no
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Not the most exciting lecturer, but really knows his stuff, you have to go to class and take good notes to do well. No textbook, lots of online reading. Papers are short but challenging. Really fair grader, tries to give students highest grade they deserve. Really interesting and relevant lecture material. I'd take another class with him.

Beyer is great. Assigns mini assignments to boost your mark and uploads a word doc in return with feedback on your work. Don't skip class, he elaborates on his slides in class quite a bit. He saved me at the end of the semester by getting notes from other students as I had gotten sick. He also allowed cheat sheets for the midterm and final exam.

An excellent, first-rate university professor.  His class is definitely not easy, but very interesting.  He expects his students to turn in 'university level' work, but he's very fair, and kind and reasonable to deal with.  If you like to learn and are willing to work, I highly recommend his classes.
Interesting and funny. He is easy going but still conveys his message. Does not require a textbook.
He's probably the best professor one can have--smart, funny, and a sense of excellence. Highly recommended.
He is funny.  Subtly funny...the best kind.  Really cool, relaxed guy.  Lots of discussion in his class.  He is the best!
Great teacher, he explains everything clairly and all his slides are useful for his projects and exam.. i actually loved that class and im taking another class with him next semester! i cant wait :)

Great professor! His slides are very useful and clear: attendance however, I believe is mandatory if you want to understand - he elaborates a lot in class and clarifies most concepts.  He was always available to help after class and throughout the week with assignments and general understanding.
Good use of powerpoints. Elaborates on points in class. Assignments and midterm were simple. Hilarious. Uber smart.

I'm a big fan of his lecture style. In this class he had slides with basic information but elaborated on them during class. He used a lot of big words that i found slightly difficult to understand at times, and i found the readings basically useless. IN CLASS however was great. Thumbs up.
Horrible class. I dropped the class half way through because I couldn't stand his lecture style and amount of information. The assignments and midterms were also unclear. Don't take a class with him!

I'm really not sure what everyone means by sense of humour. This man quite literally puts me to sleep. I took this course hoping it would fun and informative. It's fairly informative, but boring as all hell, mainly thanks to his dry and unengaging lecture style. Really not all that impressed with him.

Lazy, impersonal and unavailable. The course material is interesting, but he drains all life out of it through how he lectures. Standing at the back of the class while reading the slides and elaborating on them gives off a very detached vibe. Overall I was incredibly unimpressed.

Unlike the majority of unqualified hacks parading around this university, Peter Beyer is an exception to the rule: he is actually educated! His understanding of Islamic and Eastern religions and of their history is astounding. Do take SRS2195, you won’t regret it.

i am amazed that this man can discuss such a boring topic and hold my attention at 8:30 in the morning. i find that he is not always clear in the point he's trying to get across to students, he needs to crack his brain open a bit more. a lot of reading, but it's worth it. very fair but not a cake walk.
One of the best professors the University has on staff.  He expects a lot out of his students, but he is also fair in his assessments.  Brilliant man with a fabulous sense of humour!
